title: The Undertaker spotted with Vince McMahon in Saudi Arabia amid WWE Crown Jewel speculation
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

WWE legend The Undertaker has been pictured in Saudi Arabia with Vince McMahon.

Taker has been a regular feature in the company's blockbuster events in Saudi Arabia in the past couple of years.

He has not been booked this time after reportedly being told he will not be required for the upcoming Crown Jewel event.

But the Undertaker has made the trip to Saudi Arabia with WWE chief Vince McMahon ahead of the pay-per-view next month.

An image has emerged online of the pair in the city of Riyadh alongside a WWE fan, after being shared by Wrestling Club on social media.

The Undertaker remains a WWE legend and has been used as the face of previous events in Saudi Arabia.

The Phenom beat Rusev in a casket match at the Greatest Royal Rumble and headlined Crown Jewel with brother Kane against Triple H and Shawn Michaels.

But he was involved in disastrous bout with Goldberg at Super ShowDown in June and neither men are expected at this month's Crown Jewel.

Tyson Fury and Cain Velasquez are huge outside names scheduled to be on the show, with WWE bosses seemingly seeing Taker's presence as unnecessary.

(Image: © WWE)

The Undertaker's last match in WWE saw him partner Roman Reigns to see off Shane McMahon and Drew McIntyre at Extreme Rules.

He was recently spotted at a Glasgow branch of Nando's.

The 54-year-old - real name Mark Calaway - was in Scotland to appear at a Comic Con event in Glasgow, where fans were charged £500 for a special meet and greet.

One fan wrote on Twitter : “Imagine sitting in Nando's and you see The Undertaker eating his era mild wrap.”
description: The Undertaker has reportedly been pulled from the event in Saudi Arabia at the start of November
